recipes: Call on the Cartographer of Scars to raise a corpse to half-life
A shattering force will infuse its flesh, so that it joins the Shattered Risen. I must begin the process. I will ready my hammer.
The corpse lurches groaning to its feet: or what is left of its feet. I have conjured a Shattered Risen.
Call on the Ring-Yew to raise a corpse to half-life
First I must plant the seeds: under the eyelids, under the tongue, in all the secret openings of the body. It will awaken as a Burgeoning Risen.
The corpse sways to its feet. Its eyes struggle open. Sap trickles from its mouth. It burgeons; it has risen.
Summon one of the Name-emanations of the Forge of Days
King Crucible will come only when the room glows with the aspect called Forge. He also requires a Lantern, for the light of the Glory that he claims to know.
He can hide in a candle-flame if he must. But here he is in all his bonfire pomp. After I speak with him, the skin of my face and hands will be pink as if from too much sun.
Summon one of the Name-emanations of the Red Grail
Ezeem may enter only where the Grail's power is strong; and it will choose to enter only when invoked with the Forge, with which it has flirted so often.
So many rich aromas, like a feast upon the air! but first, and mostly, blood.
Summon the mysterious Name known as the Baldomerian
A mighty force of Lantern to draw the Baldomerian's attention, and a teasing taste of secrets to bring her closer.
The Baldomerian has the hunched shoulders of a scholar, the clear voice of a school-teacher, and the freckles of a traveller on the Continent. She lacks a shadow.
Teresa doesn't struggle; she's always up for a chat
Summon a creature of smoky deception
Forge for the smoky spirit's summoning, Winter for its binding. It must know who will rule it.
Not all the Forge's children are bright. Its offcuts and its bastards gather in the Bounds like hammerscale in the cracks of a smithy floor. Here comes one now.
Summon one of the more bewildering creatures of the Red Grail
Grail for the Raw Prophet's source, and a little Moth, for its chaos-addiction.

It enters the world one limb at a time, questing like a serpent, cawing like a crow, throbbing like a vein. It will cuddle close against my leg, if I let it, and afterwards I will have to dispose of my shoes.

A Hint was once a living mortal, and then a dead one, and now it's something else. Their summoning requires Lantern, for the light which drew them to the Mansus, and Edge, for the striving they've endured in mirrors.
The Hinter do not indulge themselves with showy entrances. A living gaze will shatter them. I know it's here, and that's enough for now.
Summon a creature of the Thunderskin
The Percussigant, merciless and merry! Heart will bring it, Edge will constrain it.

First the thump, the thump, the rattle and cry of the ceremonies it attends in the Wood. Now here it is, shouldering its way through the world's skin, like a clawed and ruthless uncle or a headless flapping bear.
Summon a servant of the Sun-in-Rags
A deep Winter's cold to name and draw the Maid-in-the-Mirror. Edge, to match her keen cruelty.
The thing that was a woman has no expression of her own. The movements of her eyes and mouth always match mine, as if I were looking in a mirror. Her fingernails are sharp as glass.
Summon one of the Voiceless Dead
These are the Dead who do not descend or ascend, but who remain in the Mansus and dream of Winter. The power of Winter, along with a little of the Heart's warmth, will draw them here.
A dark shape limned with winter light. It will not speak, but its eyes are avid, looking, looking. The Dead always long for the world, eventually.

The summoning is struggling against my control! I could use Reason to dismiss it safely, which is always reliable. I could try to reassert control with Passion, which is not reliable. Or I could let what will happen, happen.
Pronounce the words of dismissal. Seal the circle tight. Erase every trace.
The things from outside the world have many weapons: knives and riddles, fire and despair. I have weapons of my own. [This will usually, but not always, work.]
My summoning has escaped my control, where it'll wreak havoc, no doubt -
My summoning will obey my wishes - for now.
